sn14.15:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn14.15:4.2: Now at that time Venerale Sāriputta was walking meditation together with several mendicants not far from the Buddha.
sn14.15:4.3: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was doing likewise, as were
sn14.15:5.1: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants:
sn14.15:5.2: “Mendicants, do you see Sāriputta walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:5.4: “All of those mendicants have great wisdom.
sn14.15:5.5: Do you see Moggallāna walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:5.7: “All of those mendicants have great psychic power.
sn14.15:5.8: Do you see Kassapa walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:5.11: Do you see Anuruddha walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:5.14: Do you see Puṇṇa Mantāniputta walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:5.16: “All of those mendicants are Dharma speakers.
sn14.15:5.17: Do you see Upāli walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:5.19: “All of those mendicants are experts in monastic training.
sn14.15:5.20: Do you see Ānanda walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:5.22: “All of those mendicants are very learned.
sn14.15:5.23: Do you see Devadatta walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:5.25: “All of those mendicants have bad desires.
sn14.15:6.1: Sentient beings come together and converge because of an element.
sn14.15:6.2: Those interested in low things come together and converge with those interested in low things.
sn14.15:6.3: Those interested in good things come together and converge with those interested in good things.
sn14.15:8.1: At present, too, sentient beings come together and converge because of an element.
sn14.15:8.2: Those interested in low things come together and converge with those interested in low things.
sn14.15:8.3: Those interested in good things come together and converge with those interested in good things.”
